Package com.APP.Project.UserCoreLogic.phases

Class Execute

java.lang.Object
com.APP.Project.UserCoreLogic.phases.Phase
com.APP.Project.UserCoreLogic.phases.GamePlay
com.APP.Project.UserCoreLogic.phases.MainPlay
com.APP.Project.UserCoreLogic.phases.Execute
public class Execute extends MainPlay
Represents the phase in the game where all issued orders are executed.

This phase is responsible for carrying out the actions determined by players' orders. It is a critical phase in the game's lifecycle, transitioning the game state based on strategic decisions made by the players. The execution of orders can include movements of armies, battles, and other strategic actions that affect the game board. After all orders are executed, the game transitions to the next phase, typically reinforcement.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Bhoomiben Bhatt

  • Method Details

    • reinforce

      public void reinforce() throws UserCoreLogicException
      Executes the reinforcement phase of the game. In the Execute phase, reinforcing is not allowed, and invoking this command will result in an error.
      Specified by:
      reinforce in class Phase
      Throws:
      UserCoreLogicException - If an error occurs during reinforcement phase.

    • issueOrder

      public void issueOrder() throws UserCoreLogicException
      Executes the order issuing phase of the game. In the Execute phase, issuing new orders is not allowed, and invoking this command will result in an error.
      Specified by:
      issueOrder in class Phase
      Throws:
      UserCoreLogicException - If an error occurs during order issuing phase.

    • fortify

      public void fortify() throws ResourceNotFoundException, InvalidInputException
      Executes all pending orders issued by players.

      This method utilizes the ExecuteOrderService to process and execute all orders. It encapsulates the logic for the execution of game actions dictated by player orders. Exceptions may be thrown if issues arise during order execution.

      Specified by:
      fortify in class Phase
      Throws:
      ResourceNotFoundException - If required resources for executing an order are not found.
      InvalidInputException - If an order contains invalid inputs.

    • nextState

      public void nextState()
      Transitions the game to the next phase, typically reinforcement, after all orders have been executed.

      This method updates the game's phase state and prepares the game for the next set of player actions.

      Specified by:
      nextState in class Phase
